intro: Salvia austriaca var. perlanata, commonly known as the Austrian sage, is a perennial herb native to the Alps of Central Europe. It features upright, branching stems covered in grayish-green, velvety leaves. The plant produces striking violet-blue flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its aromatic foliage and long-lasting blooms.
